meanings.definition: A promise or assurance that something will be done or provided.
meanings.sent1: She gave a guaranty that she would finish her homework on time.
meanings.sent2: The company's guaranty of quality products reassured the customers.
meanings.sent3: His guaranty to always bring snacks to the movie night made him popular among friends.
meanings.sent4: The old lighthouse stood as a guaranty of safety for sailors in the stormy sea.
meanings.sent5: The guaranty of a full refund encouraged more people to try the new product.

meanings.definition: A formal assurance or promise to pay a debt or fulfill an obligation.
meanings.sent1: The written guaranty stated that the loan would be repaid in full by the end of the year.
meanings.sent2: His signature on the guaranty document bound him to cover the costs if the project failed.
meanings.sent3: The guaranty to bring a cake to the office party turned into a baking challenge.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a guaranty that everything would be alright in the end.
meanings.sent5: The guaranty of a free trial period convinced many to sign up for the service.

meanings.definition: To provide a guarantee for something.
meanings.sent1: He decided to guaranty the loan with his car as collateral.
meanings.sent2: The company will guaranty the safety of the new equipment during transportation.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly guarantied that her cat would catch the mouse in record time.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to excellence guaranties the success of the project.
meanings.sent5: The chef's reputation guaranties a delicious dining experience at the restaurant.
